zFuOm1gwICZA1V_1LyZzEg.text: Nice atmosphere. Very modern and clean. Good wasn't bad, but didn't blow my socks off. Solid burger but it doesn't hold up to some of the competition at this price point. For a $15 burger, this doesn't hold a candle to four peaks, joes farm grill, or a number of other places. I won't be returning here. Not because anything was bad... there's just better options.

photos.caption: Photo of Burger Theory - Phoenix, AZ, United States

FsSjQylBxDKLi0GkPesoUg.text: If possible I'd give no stars. My husband and I walked in the front door to a 'wait to be seated sign'. We stood waiting with no acknowledgement from any staff members. The bartender looked at us but said nothing. A server brought food out to a table but didn't look our way. This is a Monday night at 8:00. They weren't busy and if that's the type of service they provide on a regular basis, that explains why they weren't busy. After waiting for at least 5 minutes without any staff interaction, we left. We will not return. We took our business, and money, elsewhere.

33W2YIr-uy1jbCwqVei-bQ.text: First time here with my boyfriend and we looooved it. Very pretty restaurant with a chill setting. Mason was our server and he treated us newbies with great service. The fries were crispy and savory. My boyfriend ordered the Breakfast Burger and I had The Classic. We'll definitely be coming back on another date night thanks to the cook that made our food and Mason.

_GD10LDpnbkA_drAkv-qHQ.text: I felt ignored by an older bartender lady who did not share the happy hours specials with me and basically just handed me an Ultra and the proceeded to just "fuck about". I had to ask twice for my check and not even a sorry. This place is a corporate Holiday Inn pretending to be a gourmet burger bar...loose the Holiday Inn name tags people and distance yourself from that brand...

ftMGIo0xWoDOwTJMdBX9rg.text: Good food. I love the happy hour deals, and the Asian Salad is super yummy. No complaints about that at all.  By the ambience is kinda drab. I've been in three times. Once when they 1st opened and 2 times since ... All 3 times there wasn't any background music. And there are TV's all around but no sound. Just kinda sat there waiting for something to happen. But I just ate my food & left.. I'd be tempted to order takeout every once in a great while because it's close to home , but most likely won't be back.

FOPleSBnnYOAR-8cK8qu5A.text: Larry Legend made our dinner pleasurable. Dig the service and the food is excellent! My wife enjoyed her nachos, I had the Lone Star burger and Noah enjoyed his chicken fingers. Will be back!

photos.caption: Photo of Burger Theory - Phoenix, AZ, United States. The central bar area.

k3uSUPYUdyw50pChBjjJpQ.text: We showed up for lunch at about 11:45.  Placed our order at noon.  An hour and 10 minutes later, some of us at the table got our meal while other waited.  I noticed that my burger was cold when it arrived.  By that time, I was not sending anything back... I was hungry so I ate that abomination, cold cheese and all.  The slaw was ok, but I was told everyone's fries were cold and awful.  20 minutes later the rest of us got our plates.  No one liked their cold and flavorless burger and no one left even considering coming back.  Something was wrong in the kitchen, but we did not see the manager and the server told us nothing.  It would have been great to know earlier on so we can go somewhere else, but they stuck us.  They should not be in business.

tPP2Axtf8k2ing5yJAD-bA.text: Over priced -$70.00 for 4 burgers and cold fries are one thing but  top it of with a lack of service when they weren't even busy makes this restaurant a total fail! Our waitress never checked on us once during our meal or offered refills on our drinks! Clearly they don't care for return customers as we have no intention of returning. Spend your money else where

r8tQfFPD5Lfpmpz71tC7xQ.text: I had entered for lunch and was politely greeted by Raquel,she had seated me and asked me what I wanted to drink and provided me with a menu. Raquel had notified me of variety or burgers since this was my first visit,and I was sold on the Farm Fresh Burger,and a side salad. Salad came out first, and burger shortly after. Food was delicious, and Raquel had checked on me and provided wonderful service.

K9xkFWq4KEFzhJ42Ncfy3A.text: Some previous reviews had us so excited to visit. Upon arrival and being seated, it took well over 5 minutes for our waitress to arrive. (It was not crowded) The appetizer menu was small and the burgers were nothing exceptional.  This restaurant is attached to a Holiday Inn and serves as 'their' restaurant.  There are many better burger places in town to try.

OOhUPBy2e5kIJgIjfYpsTw.text: We have good service in most part.  The burger 2 days in a row burger was not what it was suppose to be.  Day ask for sauce on the side came on the burger.  Took about 15 minutes to get my burger had to send it back.  Th next came out took about 4 minutes and came out raw.  Day two order same and the stuffing of the burger look awful.  Pink not onion bacon or cheese.  Stay away from the BT Boss.  Nice clean restaurants

abt0Z7DxbalH5KkZchJaRg.text: Everything here is alright. Nothing spectacular. I didn't hate it, but I am not coming back. If you like bland and plain food, this place is perfect. Like, take your normal boring parents here I guess. It's that kinda place. The buns taste like they are from Costco. The meat was okay, the sides were okay. Previously frozen everything. The staff were cool though.

vw0ha9CCQdHQwk_z3RrCZg.text: I am giving this 1 star because the meat itself was cooked perfectly.  That said...  1) I do not believe that the Burger Theory folks know of any spices beyond salt and pepper 2) Then, they put their extremely bland meat on buns that became soggy and fell apart way before we were done eating the burger. 3) The service was great if your expectations are inexperienced, college student servers. 4) Then to top it off, they charge $10-$15 for that delightful experience.  Summary - This may be a good burger theory but unfortunately it is not a good burger practice.

3KgiMgSEvdeHracRf_sJHA.text: I've been here twice since it's opened and understand the target market and just recognize its not for me. Basic burger is ten bucks most sides (fries onion rings side salad are 3-5).I'm ok with spending that but it should be more memorable than a big Mac. Maybe I'm spoiled living in the arm pit of Arcadia but I have the attic zinnburger delux burger hop daddy all pretty close by. For Travellers staying at the hotel this is the perfect spot. Great selection of drafts and beers in general. Very clean spacious modern looking spot that locals would be shocked to find at 44th st Mcdowell. I think I'd be more likely to hit it up for happy hour then do legit dive bar hopping nearby... Because I have a sweet tooth maybe I get wowed by the dessert choices and bump it up a star down the road... Fwiw I had the classic this time and bbq bacon last time which was definitely more memorable... Just bummed the house signature burger is blah

oUU-HRA4YdGRCR24gzQEHQ.text: Holy Burger!!! I came in and asked my server Carrie "what do I want?" She suggested the Farm Fresh Burger. MAN! She was so right, that was exactly what I needed..It was delightful! GREAT FOOD AND FANTASTIC SERVICE!

-w6_6n6zFChRp6d4SyZMPg.text: Wow, what a great burger. The Lonestar is awesome. Fries were heaven and the local beers were so good.

4pLFzmk-4gSeoVFrmHS_cQ.text: Was pretty hyped to go here with our friends from out of town. Service was friendly but other than that, the food was seriously worth only 2 stars. Burger came out burnt. Like literally burnt tasting when I asked for medium. Burger was also over sauced and gooey. I'm a huge food lover and usually if there's anything left on the plate I'll ask for a to go box and I left 3/4 of my food on the plate to be trashed. Would say the only food that tasted good here was the appetizers.

0JKR8PBsYRat0W-yj_8gwQ.text: Horrible horrible horrible service. I drive past this place regularly and had always thought about trying it despite it being empty all the time. Called in for a to-go order around 4 o'clock, Sabrina took my order and told me would be 10-15 minutes. I arrive 20 minutes later to a completely empty restaurant. Despite multiple signs advertising happy hour starting at 4. I spend about five minutes walking around the entire restaurant before I take a seat at the bar and then decide to call the restaurant. I hear the phone ring on speaker for about another minute before someone emerges from the back. Employee seems disoriented and confused. I informed him about my to go order which he tells me he never received. If the service is any indication of the food it's probably a disaster as well. Also assume this is a common occurrence based on the lack of apologetic attitude and general numbness displayed by the restaurants 1 employee.

H3hrXPyB-UO5Mx9XaM6jtg.text: I met my wife at Burger Theory yesterday for lunch expecting a mouth watering delicious burger...... what a disappointment.    The restaurant was not busy at all, and it took 25 minutes to get our burgers.   Then after specifically telling the server that I did not want a pickle anywhere near my plate, ugh.... pickle spear with its juice running into my onion rings.   He did bring me a new order of onion rings, but I think they were ones sitting in the back, since the first order was hot and fresh and the replacement cold and soft ish.    My wife ordered her burger medium and hers was medium well, I ordered medium rare and it was close, but a bit underdone and the meat was cold.   I assume they took mine off earlier than hers and just let it sit.    I expected a lot more than two mediocre burgers (one with fries and the other with onion rings) a water, and an ice tea for $35.00.   Won't be back.  Too bad, I really hoped to have a great burger place between my wife's work and mine where we could meet for lunch.  Ed in Phoenix

6HlpKhczWJUQhPyTRiEhtA.text: Burgers your way! The Onion rings are the best in AZ, taste homemade. Friendly, there to please staff. Make sure you have them add an egg to your burger. Enjoyed the beer selection, the Koffee Kolsch is a perfect breakfast beer.

my4sgxKPpjvm-CrNDBndWQ.text: Average burger joint. Location could be better. More of a bar really. You would think for a place called burger theory there would be more options of burgers or toppings. I think Carla jr. Has more options but then again they did have a burger with a hot dog and chips so that's pretty hard to top.  I had the philly and it was good don't get me wrong it just needed a little something more to get it out of the ordinary. Maybe more toppings, maybe a bun that didn't come right out of a grocery store.  Also we were never given napkins and had to ask for them but that's something small and the waiter was actually really nice. Three stars is by no means a poor review it's just really average.

photos.caption: Photo of Burger Theory - Phoenix, AZ, United States. The Philly

bc77CA4qeaKN9bIbnfZVNg.text: Great beer selection and delicious food. I highly recommend the Farm Fresh burger, the portobello mushroom and caramelized onions were amazing! We also had the Big Dog which was great. Unfortunately, the burgers don't come with fries. But fries are reasonably priced (only $3 with a burger) and are very tasty.   Definitely stop in for happy hour! Beers are cheap and appetizers are $2 off.   Our waiter, Ben, was attentive, hilarious, and very personable. He kept us (and our "neighbors" at the next table over) laughing. He also did a great job of providing useful, but not pushy recommendations.

photos.caption: Photo of Burger Theory - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Tasty S&#39;mores Mason Jar dessert. $5
Photo of Burger Theory - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Amazing Big Dog. $7
Photo of Burger Theory - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Delicious Farm Fresh burger. $10

90lgPIHf4dzMeiH9N9dKhg.text: The space is gorgeous, the hamburgers were tremendously good. I think the only thing I think they should add are some different bun options, I would have loved to get a pretzel bun!  I ordered the special, a spicy siracha burger and a beer on tap, a;; were tasty and loved the presentation. My son ordered the kids burger and it was the same size as mine so it was perfect! The service was friendly and attentive!  They have daily drink and dinner specials and a happy hour - will return!

photos.caption: Photo of Burger Theory - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Papa
Photo of Burger Theory - Phoenix, AZ, United States. A good Sunday happy hour with burgers!

AS9Ri89_2EEnkF5-Iqh5Fw.text: Came here at 6:00 PM on January 24, 2018. The food is good, but their service could improve. 1) I ordered a chicken breast burger with Swiss, bacon, lettuce and tomato with onion rings. The sandwich and rings were very good. 2) I sat at the bar and ordered food and beer, but the male bartender needs to do a better job to be aware of customers with empty glasses: patrons wait for greater than 10 minutes on a slow Wednesday night to be asked if they would like another drink. 3) a customer sitting next to me at the bar had to wait 42 minutes for her chicken sandwich and rings. That's a bit excessive when my order arrived within 10 minutes of ordering. 4) the same customer sitting next to me waited 13 minutes with her empty glass for the male bar tender to be available to ask for another drink...on a slow Wednesday night. The male bar tender does not know how to work with a sense of urgency and multi-task. 5) the female manager on duty did a good job looking around seeing if anyone needed anything, except for the nice female customer sitting next to me at the bar on a slow Wednesday night.  Bottom line, good food and drinks, but customer service can improve with training and care. After all, customer service is a choice to be delivered by anyone, but need guidance and development to 'delight' the customer.

IpWYIPJ8kJIrN9IMYmlCtA.text: Went there at 1pm on a Saturday Slow service. 30+ min to cook a burger  Had the border burger, boooring burger.   No flavor, some flimsy bun, not even toasted Way too guacamole on one side, nothing on the other  Should have gone to McDonald's or burger king, 1/2 the price 100 time the flavor  No plans to return.  Ever

m4p-BwMqJLNaPOuLewyetg.text: I went here about two weeks ago and ordered some chicken tenders . They cost me about $10 and there were about 5 whole pieces. I would not recommend coming here . They were really good though.

YxInzrlGUxeu-vzG-0dJxw.text: The food was so good, we had the firecracker shrimp and burgers. The shrimp were really good, and the burgers OMG, so juicy and flavorful.  The staff were really attentive and very helpful!

photos.caption: Photo of Burger Theory - Phoenix, AZ, United States. My husband had Swiss cheese and mushrooms
Photo of Burger Theory - Phoenix, AZ, United States. I had double with blue cheese, bacon and all the veggies

AgYkmayOZ2YiX6kaOKvIqw.text: I really like the interior of the restaurant. It's very clean, open and I love the large wooden door leading  into the restaurant. I also like that they have both indoor and outdoor seating. I ordered a cheeseburger which came with a pickle and I got a side of killer burger sauce that was recommended by the server. The burger was a little to greasy & nothing about the burger wowed me. The price can add up fast because everything is a la carte. your burger might be $9 but add the sides ( add $3.50) then you have to add a drink ( add another $2.50 ); its easily a $15 meal for just one person. I don't mind paying extra for the food but the food wasn't amazing. Also our server was nice but the service was slow and it took forever to get our food.

photos.caption: Photo of Burger Theory - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Bloody Mary!
Photo of Burger Theory - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Build your own burger

nZu0fuNNBISRPOhyknpIjQ.text: I'm shocked that Burger Theory doesn't have a higher overall rating. I just had their classic burger with bacon, and was pretty blown away. Perfect beef, and the potato bun is key! Wonderful, and looking forward to going back!

s3utcpGTDo9FSFZTyzB0NQ.text: Food was ok, nothing to get super excited about. Fast food would have done the same, not to mention the kids menu is not very pleasing at all.. beer selection was better than the food if I ever went back I would only get beer and some chicken.. that's a big if too!

hgKWOJ_UMc7y3Cbpp2xmyQ.text: Their food is pretty good for the price, especially if you're looking for a delicious fancy burger & you dont want fast food. Cool place to watch a game at the bar & they have an outdoor patio. Its an awesome atmosphere. Nice place to hang out on the weekends with a few friends & grab a drink & burgers.

eEVX267jOAQvbV7AOKnuAw.text: Great new place, burgers are just phenomenal! Definitely coming back, good happy hour Too!  Staff is great...can't wait to be back with friends Oh and the Nachos are the best I've had.

photos.caption: Photo of Burger Theory - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Best Happy hour!!! And burgers

8tN75rCyPvBIdbudmwP0yA.text: The outdoor patio is a nice touch. They also have a decent draft beer selection so I am giving them 2 stars vs 1.    What I wasn't a fan of was the service starting with the gal who seated us to the lack of personality our server had.  The food was also ok...nothing special. As someone visiting a friend in town, i left unimpressed...my friend who is a local said that she would only go for convenience as its located close to her home.    They need to train their staff to provide better service.

RKsGT2jJyZz-T_ahgEe0-Q.text: Breakfast buffet included scrambled soft eggs, tex mex offerings (e.g. fresh stewed beans, shredded cheddar, and Pico de gallo), roasted home style fries, hot oatmeal, and fresh cut fruit. All included with our rewards package.

-Cu3OcK7MQqkU30KYZCe9w.text: We tried this place out since it was so close to our home and we love burgers!  The environment was clean and stylish, making a good atmosphere for dinner date. We chose the patio which although just overlooks a busy intersection with pan handlers, did display a beautiful sunset that night.   The menu looked good, we thought the beer selection was good, especially having 12 draft beers.  Service was very fast and friendly.  I ordered the Uptown burger with mushrooms instead of a big portobello. They did forget the mushrooms altogether but I was actually starving and didn't care, didn't want to wait for mushrooms. We also ordered fries, they come in a cute little bucket. Everything was average tasting, I prefer toasted buns on a burger.  But all in all the convenience of the location will probably bring us back, we did hear there were good happy hour prices and would like to try the nachos

photos.caption: Photo of Burger Theory - Phoenix, AZ, United States. The patio is perfect for good weather
Photo of Burger Theory - Phoenix, AZ, United States. The Uptown and side of fries

Vab_qHfv6WvpfBcqrvRA8g.text: Not impressed. I was here because there were no other food options in the hotel (Holiday Inn and Suites, Airport North) open at 11:45am for lunch. Upon entering, I looked around for a server and found none. There WAS one bartender who told me to choose a seat anywhere. Ok. I chose a seat and waited for about 5 minutes for someone to come by. When the server arrived, I asked what I could get fast because I had a conference starting up again at 12:15pm. Not much, was the answer. Also, when I asked how long it would take for my order to arrive if I put it in now, I was told 30 minutes due to high volume.  The place was NOT BUSY. Strike one.  Strike two was when I spoke to my server again and asked for an order of fries. She looked at me, said "Devon is your server," then walked away. That made absolutely no sense to me.   When she walked by my table again, I asked her what she meant by "Devon is your server." I guess I looked a bit annoyed because the manager came over and asked me what the situation was. I explained that I had very limited time for lunch, was hoping to place an express order, and that the server told me that any order at the time would take at least 30 minutes. The manager said that was not correct and got some fries for me because that was really the only thing I could get quickly, i.e. within 5 minutes (I was cutting it pretty close to the afternoon session of the conference).   When I asked if I could finish my fries at my original table, the manager said she would prefer it if I would move to the high top table beside the bar, since I wasn't getting a full meal and was going to leave soon. Um, ok. I thought that was a little rude, but she comped my fries, so I guess we're even.  Overall, I would not come back here. Maybe my original server was new, or perhaps the kitchen really was overloaded with orders. I wasn't pleased with the service and I do not want to waste my time or money at a place that doesn't appear to want me or my money.

t6RnkwxxnWfunIoxRi7vxw.text: Service "bar tender" was slow, unatentative, and unapologetic when our order came out wrong...went about his day like business as usual.    The burger flavor was actually decent, but I've had much better for the $16 I paid for it.  Won't be back!

FNBYPZC2HiWK2wR32mzYCQ.text: Great service and they were open late. The burger was good nothing spectacular but they nailed exactly what I wanted.

ulxlh-WvStheOHqnlx0Rbw.text: I've been here a few times for lunch since I work down the street.  The food is more miss than hit but I have enjoyed it at times.  There is a nice selection of local beers and the patio is nice in the winter.  The service on the other hand is horrible.  I've had to get up from my table and go to the bar for refills.  My order has been wrong.  I've had to chase down the server to ask for the check, after sitting with an empty plate and glass for 30min.  The nicest thing I can say about the help is that their shirts are funny.  :)  I will return since it's close to work, the food is edible (even if it isn't great) and because I want to see if it gets any better (service and food).

tYAydzo54TZNk_BY6E9u4A.text: Great burgers! I had the Lone Star Burger single patty. Very delicious with the BBQ sauce. Service was very good. Cleavon did an excellent job helping me with the menu. He even knew how ounces the burgers were. Wow!!! I was impressed with that. Nice dining area. There seemed to be a lot of people from out of town eating here too. It's great to see restaurants busy.

photos.caption: Photo of Burger Theory - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Lone Star Burger

xmQHk0u7Hq2zxZPbgexhjQ.text: We gave Burger Theory a try today for the first time.  Our server, Ben, was phenomenal! He was personable, efficient and entertaining! I ordered the special for the day which was a patty melt.  It was quite delicious! There was a minor mix up with the type of cheese on my sandwich, but both the server and the manager were more than eager to make up for the goof up.  I was very pleased with the quality of the food and the level of customer service we were given.  It's a tad pricey, with all items being a la carte, but we all agreed that our food was scrumptious! We will definitely be back for more!

B-8RV7e1MTiZeOaRPgMRgg.text: We came in for a quick burger and salad. Our server, Ben, was great. Even with a small computer problem we didn't notice a delay in the food. The lone star burger was great and cooked the way I like it. The fries had a great seasoning. The crispy chicken salad was delicious.

PvSo14CH_Pf1cYM_zI-FFw.text: Was looking foward for this Holiday Inn burger and beer restaurant to open and waited until yesterday to try it out for lunch. Opted for a table instead of sitting at the large bar. Ordered a single beef burger, all the veggies, blue cheese, house sauce (server said it was "just like 1000 Island dressing") and onion rings.  The space is pretty sparse with minimal decor/decoration. One large group/communal table sat a group of at least 10, 7 sitting at the bar and people were at five to six  tables. Everyone was in a great mood and resulted in the place being really loud.  Food came out on a half sheet pan. Burger, pickle slice and a small galvanized tin bucket for the onion rings.  The burger was pretty close to the ordered medium rare temp, and a small amount of blue cheese was beneath the meat. The onion rings were awesome....all 5 of them. At $3.50 or .70 per ring they had better be good.  Had to bypass the nice beer selection as this was a work day. Expected a few bumps, food coming out slow and had to pay at the bar as the server looked like he was on the phone with the register/point of sale system problems. The bartender was quick to overcome the problem by ringing up a new order and he was able to cash me out in just a few minutes. Again I came in expecting these opening week jitters. While the food was OK the bill was over $13, without tip, for a 1/3 lb. single patty blue cheese burger, all the veggies, 5 onion rings and a glass of wate. If one were a business traveler with an expense account and ended up staying at the Airport Holiday Inn you wouldn't blink at the check amount. However, being a local who knows where a lot of great burger places with lower prices that are just as far of a drive is another matter.

SoVbiS8B5bnaK1ei2J_tzg.text: New place, nice as staying in nearby hotel.   I like the build a burger on the menu.  Friendly and efficient staff, good job Chris and Louisa!

QgZkddrwMxeQHeeKMa4t4Q.text: I can make a great burger at home so when I go out, I want to be floored when I spend $9 on burger,the Philly burger was good but not worth the wait.

eURyeAwkp24c6X2JDJTMzg.text: My wife made me come here and it was amazing! The atmosphere is perfect.  At each booth there is a television, which is amazing. I don't really watch the television while I eat but the placement in most restaurants make me angry. The music is very befitting to the name burger theory. Our waiter, Larry Legend, had a great attitude and a lot of energy. He kept my drink full which is the most important part of eating out, at least in my opinion. He also had a smile everytime he came over.  I had a veggie burger with a fried egg add on which was awesome. It made my mouth and tongue so happy. The fries came in an awesome bucket and they were awesome. I hope everyone has a chance to enjoy burger theory. As a vegetarian they by far have the best veggie burger in town. Thank you Larry Legend for an amazing evening.

1HhIXshGCxUxQnNUQr-iTw.text: The firecracker shrimp here is tasty, drinks are great and Chris has taken good care of us! I highly recommend this place!

kXSlRm0pPhsQywFZj08hxw.text: The waiter gave us the specials which was two burgers and a draft for $12. Fair enough good deal. Food was decent service was a bit slow for it being 2/3's empty. When the bill came my buddy's meal was $23 not $12. We informed the waiter that there was a mistake and he apologized for the mix up as he mistakenly told us the wrong burger for the special. However a manager came and said they could not change the price of the meal, even after we explained to her the mix up. She did not even seem to care. As you can guess I will not be returning.

wlxKANWwbjWiqZnUwMfq3w.text: I would consider Burger Theory a step above the average hotel restaurant and a step below the better, self-standing burger joints.  My burger was juicy and the overall taste was great, however, such a great burger should be on a good bun - not the generic foodservice buns that crumble apart.  There is a full bar and good assortment of local craft beers, plus a multitude of TVs at the bar and booths in the dining area, making this a good place for a game or for casual dining.  If you like Applebee's or TGI Friday's for their atmosphere, you'll like Burger Throery.  Get a solid meal, good service, and enjoy some local beers.

bWJ1xzLmJEiBZWJFs4bLGA.text: My friend and I went here because it looked like a cool place to go sit eat and drink. As we walked in there was signage that read "daily special burger and a beer $12". Keep in mind that its 3:30 in the afternoon. When our server came to greet us we told him we'd both have the daily special. He then told us that it was yesterdays special, but since the sign was up he was going to talk to the manager. He came back about three minutes later to tell us that they couldnt honor the special because it was "yesterdays special".  False advertisement? If the manger would have come to our table to explain or if they would have taken down the sign right there and then I wouldn't have been so upset. Thats horrible customer service and they lost two hungry patrons....

Tjz-ODfbbVlJzEuLen0b2g.text: In for lunch. Great service and food. Comfortable casual setting. Great spot for quick business lunch.

m7WvDctyaukLDncjaQpjzQ.text: I was excited to try this place, and it was okay. Not great, but just okay. You can definitely get a better burger at Applebee's. What inspired me to leave a review was that while this place is just "meh, okay," it is OUTRAGEOUSLY expensive. I ordered lunch for four: one chopped salad with shrimp (which ended up being a regular garden salad with 3 medium-sized shrimp on top), 2 single BYOBs with bacon & cheese and a double burger with no extras (all 3 with onion rings, which you only get about 3 or 4 rings with each order) and my total for everything was $67 and change. This was take-out, so I can't comment on the service, but I will tell you that if they had given me the order total when I'd called it in, I would NOT have ordered from here. There is also no pricing anywhere on the website to reference. I feel for the employees because it is appears the business is poorly run on a higher level & very unorganized. When I arrived to pick up my order, their credit card terminals were down & they couldn't run my card for payment and the manager, not knowing what else to do, took my phone number & said he would call me to take my payment over the phone once their terminals were back online. Up to this point I was still not provided with a receipt or total for my order. It wasn't until an hour or so later when someone (not the manager) called to take my payment info that I was told how much everything had cost. Not cool.

JU-KCrtJKg0U3G6qGyDv0w.text: We went there after we saw the restaurant on Channel 3. The food looked good and we decided to give it a try.  My husband liked the burger even though the fries were soggy.  The salad I ordered was horrible.  It was a $13 salad and supposed to be served with mixed greens and rib eye (I asked what cut of meat it would be) The salad came with romaine only,  a couple of tomatoes and a few cucumber pieces.  The meat was chewy and definitely not rib eye. Very disappointing.  The waitress gave us a discount on the salad but it is not a place to go back to.  Not impressed.....

m-6bfd7pMyppUKWEX5Ox9Q.text: We were looking forward to a good burger while watching sports at the Burger Theory on 44th St & McDowell Rd.  Here was our experience: * No hostess was near the stand so the bartender yelled for someone to help us even though it was not hectic. * Many of the patio tables were filthy including the one we received.  Yet the person who directed us to this table never cleaned it; they left it for the server to clean. Never saw a bus-person working while we were there. * Short staffed on a sports evening resulted in slow service yet our waitress was running as fast as she could on her own. * The waitress took the order correctly yet the kitchen over cooked all our burgers (medium rare order resulted in a well-done burgers) and the fries were very greasy. * Our waitress apologized stating this had been happening all night.  Felt bad for her, because this probably lowered her tips even though it was not her fault.  After speaking with her manager, our server said we'd get a discount which ended up being a Veteran's discount along with the server's apology which was nice; the cooking temp. of our food was not the servers fault but the Manager should have came to our table to touch base with us.   If a burger restaurant can't cook the temperature of their burgers correctly then we will not recommend this restaurant to anyone even if they are staying at the attached Holiday Inn, which is a shame since there's plenty of seating and tv's to watch a game at this location.

YYe25gbrqdCco4ITwN3rhw.text: This place was on the property of Holiday Inn Express Ana I was staying there for the night. After a long day of work and travel from San Diego to Phoenix I was looking forward to a relaxing meal.  I was told by the bartender to sit anywhere. The wait staff were all standing at the bar on their phones and joking with each other for 5 minutes until finally one saw me. Service was sooooooo slooooow. Good thing I wasn't in a hurry like the lady behind me who waited almost an hour for a salad  The beer selection is great and my meal was classic cheese burger and onion rings. It was good but not great. Onion rings were lukewarm but the burger had great flavor  Don't bother if you are in a hurry

nS9VuiIR14PASZo6GmHupw.text: I've been eager to try this spot since they opened at the hotel. Food looks good, local craft beer and a beautiful remodel- what more could I ask for within walking distance?   Well, I can't imagine going back. The problems started when my waiter, a nice young guy, brought me the menu. See, something was very wrong with what could be an amazing local draft list on happy hour. I saw that the Brown had the same description as the White Ale, and that the Kolsch was named incorrectly (Gold Road, not Old Road), the KiltLifter description had a typo and the Sonoran White Chocolate was described as a fruity hop bomb.   I called my waiter over to let him know that these menus were all screwed up and that folks wouldn't be getting the beers they hoped for- his response? "Oh, hmm, I've never read the menu. I can just kinda describe them to you". Problem is, I'm passionate about our local AZ beer scene, I know the beers well and some of the folks that work hard to get them on the menu at a new hip restaurant that caters to tourists- so I'm appalled that he couldn't care less. I requested he talk to his manager since this should be corrected ASAP, and he said "ok". So, that was that. I stuck with water since I'm still confused what they actually have on tap.   Our food was cheap- but really not impressed. The kitchen didn't put any dressing on my salad or on the side, so that was odd. Then my mom's nachos- which come with beans- had a ton of olives but no beans to be found. I mentioned this to our nonchalant waiter, who told her "There are beans, I see them...here." And he pointed within inches of her plate- counting out 4 beans. Then he offered to get some more. Right. So that's how  that went. Paid out bill and luckily it was very cheap (with our waters) because the experience wasn't great. He was nice enough, just clueless- and he wasn't even close to the worst part.   I told my mom that I really hope they fix the menu since I'd looked forward to coming here often in the fall for football and craft beer. She suggested I tell someone else- so at the front I mention to who I thought was the hostess- that the menu wasn't correct - She interrupted me to let me know she already heard. I continued that I was so excited to see a hotel restaurant in my neighborhood feature our local beer and I just wanted them to get it right for the visitors- she said "yea, have a good night" and walked away. I can't remember the last time an employee was so blatantly rude. She didn't apologize, thank me for letting them know, assure me that management woukd address it- no, she walked away.   Now, I planned to go back- I planned to give them a few more shots. But to have both employees blow me off about a completely wrong menu? Unacceptable. The food wasn't nearly good enough to put up with that.

Hnyqvc82_VOEcNPJlnuD1Q.text: Fast service and the firecracker shrimp is one of my favorites. Staffs are always friendly and helpful.

iopP1zIsNws9TXf-FLXHAw.text: We came here for lunch today because my dad had driven by it and wanted to scope it out. It was $30 for two burgers, onion rings, and one soda - and there are dozens of other places I would've rather spent that money. It feels like a Red Robin meets a Buffalo Wild Wings with Denny's style service.   We got there just after they opened; it's a tuesday in the middle of summer. There were only a few tables making them clearly over-staffed (a bartender, 4 servers, a manager, and a guy that just stood around) but no one was seating the tables. We were halted at the door while the party ahead of us looked to choose their own seat. The sign said "wait to be seated" though the previous group hadn't, so I asked if it was "seat your self." the bartender told me one server had gotten a table and the next server up would take us... Hire a host.  I went to the restroom after being seated and the toilets wouldn't flush; none of them. I told the manager when I came out and she looked at me and said, "Oh, they turned the water off!" That's pecuilar, gross, and I'm pretty sure illegal during business hours. She made no apology and lacked any sort of authoritative presence. She was also walking around, drinking a cup of water - which isn't a good look. Our server was awkward - nice but not helpful, kind of timid. I felt like everyone there was experiencing their first day in the hospitality industry; it was sort of painful. They didn't really know the menu or how to act with customers.  I ordered a burger, but then heard another server talking about the special Sonoran burger and ran over to change my order. I joked with him about not telling me about the special - he told me he didn't even know they were doing that...   The burger that came out was pretty lame for $9. It had way too much limp iceberg lettuce under the patty, and the jalapenos and sriracha mayo were just thrown in the center. This is not a $9 burger, it made me feel like it was someone on the line's first day too.  The food tasted decent. I had a turkey patty, my dad had all beef and said it was good quality. We enjoyed the onion rings, also. They were nothing special, but were cooked well. We both said we'd never come back for it / could've made the burgers at home - but it filled our need to eat.  It's clear they put a lot of money into the building; hopefully they can work out the kinks..  Pros: Turkey patty, veggie patty, chicken patty option in addition to beef burgers Large beer list Lots of tvs (if you're into that) Clean feeling (except for the toilet flushing incident.) Nice patio (when it's not melting outside)  Cons: High price for what you get Unprofessional / awkward staff Sloppily put together burgers for $9-$15 per burger Water was turned off during business hours making toilets unflushable Weird Vibe

photos.caption: Photo of Burger Theory - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Sonoran Burger... Lots of limp iceberg lettuce, a turkey party, poorly melted cheese + a dollop of sriracha mayo  + jalapeños. Lame.

GoFRFEjqnhSBx8pgXHO5iA.text: Absolutely a major improvement over the previous restaurant located at the hotel. I am here as part of the University of Michigan Alumni for the hockey game. The hotel has made incredible remodeling done right. The restaurant has a great marketing options. I would suggest that you market the sports bar to area University Alumni clubs. A area (Dallas Tx) restaurant /sports bar recently reached out to our club and started hosting our watch parties every Saturday for the  football season. The restaurant has more than doubled there sales and in return donates 10% of the sales to the scholarship committee. The Alumni club now uses there business to watch hockey, basketball and other games.  The business is a little slow but with the right marketing it could become a great sports bar. I am sure that there are numerous local Alumni clubs that would love this venue.

L4VRIuaCwhmxEvW7SejhsA.text: I am only giving 2 stars because the manager did the right thing in the interest of serving people.   Myself along with my fiance, 3 kids under 6-(I over tip when we go out due to my bebe's kids) and my fiance's nephew went on a Friday night to Burger Theory. Pass it driving all the time-looks like a cool spot. That's about it. Looks cool. If your just going to drink and watch a game it's perfect. Not the cheapest, but a nice spot! The place is dead! We wait a few minutes to get seated by our waiter. Kind of a dry guy-not the most friendly dude in the world.  Place our drink order and they come quickly. Place our food order and this is where we run into a problem.   2 of our meals come out 35 minutes later. My kids and fiancee nephews food is nowhere in site.   I ordered the chicken tenders appetizer...wow...it was the burnt left over debris from the bottom of a deep fryer basket! In 33 years I've complained MAYBE 3 times at a restaurant! It's not in my blood to be one of those guys...I have respect for myself and others. However this was appalling! My girl starts getting pissed that the kids don't have their food-10 minutes later the server comes (separate employee brought the "food" to us) and says he forgot to put the rest of the order in. We decide to high tail it out of there. I have 3 hungry kids...  Ask for the manager and she profusely apologized and offered to cancel the whole check including my beer.  I insist on paying for the beer to tip the server something (even if he wasn't the most friendly guy and messed up)  McDonald's for the kids it was!  Sucks cause this place looked good!   Thanks to the manger for doing the right thing!!

Wings: we got 7 wings and even with the happy hour price it came to more than a dollar per wing. They were good, not great. We also ordered the flatbread tuscan chicken. Beers were fairly priced, but other reviews note the emphasis on local brews, and other than the standards you see everywhere else, I didn't see anything special.  I would come back again and try the burger. It looked good, but very small. Stay away from the overpriced appetizers.

The guacamole on the On The Border burger was from a can. The KGB sauce was basic fry sauce  (ketchup & mayo). Costco sells better buns.  The best part of the meal was the dill pickle which likely was out of a jar.

udSjUZvc46CpoXor6n4j7Q.text: Burger Theory is a nice Arcadia-style place in East/Central Phoenix.  It is located in the Holiday Inn at 44th St. and E. McDowell, but there is a separate entrance so you don't have to walk thru the hotel.     The dining/room bar area is modern and upbeat, and the patio is surprisingly easy to have a conversation on, considering the proximity to McDowell Rd.  It was nearing sunset when we visited, and the staff kindly lowered the sunshades on the patio for us.   Burger Theory has a great tap list that focuses on AZ beers, plus a generous daily happy hour 4p-7p with drink and appetizer specials.  Tyler was our server and she was awesome!  All of the staff was very friendly and gave this place a nice vibe.   The Farm Fresh burger came loaded with portobello mushrooms and roasted peppers, all dripping with cheese.  It was delicious!  They offer a lettuce wrap (by request) if you prefer to swap out the bun.   There were a number of other burgers, salads, and mason jar desserts that I wanted to try. We ended up enjoying burgers and several drinks for two for under $40.00.  I'll definietly be visiting Burger Thoery again soon!

t6yPkjCaCuXCXeNjwvwU2Q.text: Stopped in there with a group of 7 or 8 of us and took 30 minutes to get out our food after we ordered which would have been fine if they were busy. There was only about 4 or 5 people in there before us and they were served.   Once we got it, it was good and the chicken wings were not scrawny so that was nice,  Lucky there was a football game on so the time it took wasn't such a big issue

Can't fault a place after that for taking ownership...I ordered the single with all the veggies and added bacon, their special sauce and a fried egg with a side of onion rings. This burger came out perfect! The egg was cooked perfect and on the first bite all the yolk oozed out and it was a mess just like I wanted. It was like breakfast in between 2 buns. The onions rings as well were a great addition plus I thought you can get fries anytime and these were super good....sorry to see they are getting some tough reviews because the layout of this place is great with tons of outdoor seating and and tvs everywhere to not miss any game. Great spot to grab a beer and a burger and for those of you that don't like beef they have chicken, turkey and meatless options as well..

E2JiRvjdeFnto_Ljo79xoA.text: I am here out of town for work training and had a long day. Needed some food to take back to my room and I heard good things about here. I have to say they weren't kidding. They were a little busy but nothing crazy. All of the staff was very kind with a smile on their faces. I picked up my order at the bar and the bartender Camilo was so pleasant. He had taken my order over the phone and when they brought out my food he remember to get the extra condiment that I asked for. He used my name and didn't make me feel rushed for only having a to go order making the quick stay pleasant. Thank you and if I'm ever back in town I am definitely coming back.

k0OXIzgFk9DCglIX0y2x8Q.text: Dining area: very clean, received drink quickly, and light so you can see each other, the pictures, tvs. A great option for dining outside is also available.  Staff: the staff my group interacted with very nice and courteous. We did have an issue with one of the orders, and the wait staff gave a few suggestions to correct the error.  Food: The meals are on the pricey side for the portions given. A burger is between $9 and $15 and the sides are additional (between $3 and $5). I've eaten here twice and the food has not really improved. My burger had WAY too much sauce on it and very very greasy.  Gave 2 stars because I go to places to eat for a good price and the food was meh and the price was higher than I would expect for what given. This area is trying to revitalize itself and there are many other options available which have much better food options.

cltjNAax0zhFzad2zvsVdQ.text: I go by this place all the time and today I had opportunity to try them out.  Mediocre is all I can say about their food.  I would have done better getting my burger and fries at a fast food joint.  I expect a whole lot better in a sit down burger bar/restaurant - especially with a title like theirs.  Most of their stuff is smothered in bacon and they skimp on the dressings and condiments.  With all the beer you would think they would make their own beer-battered onion rings.  Nope!  Poorly prepared food and cheap ingredients.  They do have a nice selection of specialty beers, though.  They should change their name to Beer Theory.  Then maybe they would learn how to make a True american burger.  My server was a nice, attentive young man (Francisco).  Because of him I give this place two stars Instead of one. I do not recommend this place for burgers.

YMYmlX5qGOhfqpQisLxTZQ.text: I've driven past this place so many times and I finally tried it today.... I love to speak to my waiters and joke with them so they feel comfortable I guess wrong on my part the guy that was waiting us didn't care for it so I left it alone. We ordered some drinks and he walked away so fast we didn't even get to order an appetizer. We were told it was happy hour and that the drinks would be $5 I look at the happy hour menu and it says it's $6 okay no biggie. We ordered margaritas idk what the bartender made but it Def wasn't a margarita I asked if we could try something else since the drinks tasted off. The bartender made the drinks and then I saw them sit there and the waiter walk past them at least 3 times. I almost went and got them myself, he came with the food so we were happy and then brought the drinks. Tried the new drinks  and they also didn't taste like what it was supposed to be, at this point I gave up on having an alcoholic beverage. I'm giving two stars because the food wasn't bad it was pretty good. I really wanted to like this place but the service was really slow, it took the waiter 30 minutes from the time we asked for the check til we had are card back so we could leave. Given that he had to fix our check to take my drink off I still don't think it should have taken that long for us to pay and get out of there. Don't think I'll be returning.

dJgYsLCfavVWusmov5sGGw.text: The service was undeniably bad Came into town and we were starving. We walked into this place, while it was fairly empty, not too busy. We ordered the fish tacos and asked for a side of fries as an app, because we figured it'll be quick and again I was really hungry.  It took 45min for our fish tacos to come out, not to mention the 20min it took to receive a menu and be greeted. We asked for the fries multiple times, never arrived, all the while I saw another table get fries.  I honestly don't understand what the deal was. We ate away at our'explore the city' time, so after hour and half of no fries-we left.  Not even an apology.

eD1aj2THAChrqeA1kC3IWA.text: Good burgers and cold drinks. Price is a bit high but good if you want a casual burger.

VDj42S54uM8mzIdnyewwgw.text: Let me preface this... This is not the review I was anticipating writing. And that's because this is the second time I've been to Burger Theory with my co-workers. The previous visit was good enough to entice us to come back. This visit was especially disappointing.  Most of the five guys (burger pun un-intended) I ate lunch with today, were there for the first visit as well. Collectively, we agreed that after the number of miscues today, we don't see much of a reason to return.  The highs: The environment is modern, inviting and clean. Regardless of the service, the burgers are really delicious. My BT Burger with the house KGB sauce was cooked perfectly (med rare) last time. And the Lone Star (this visit) with bacon, BBQ sauce and an onion ring was also wonderful, despite being cooked med well.  The lows: We chalked up the poor service on our previous visit to the fact that Burger Theory had just opened. I guess we were optimistic that the opening jitters had subsided. Unfortunately, they haven't.  Our server today was very friendly, but that will only get  you so far. Today we were celebrating a birthday. We waited a very long time for the food to arrive and the birthday boy didn't get a turkey burger as requested. It was beef and over cooked. He sent it back and ultimately waited so long for the re-cook that he had it boxed to go. The burgers didn't all arrive at the same time either. One of my co-workers asked for a drink refill. His glass was taken and never returned. When our server learned of the birthday, he insisted that he bring out the complimentary chocolate mousse. Because there was no priority on getting the re-cook to the table, the mousse was all he ate.  Then, an attitude was detected when asked to split the check five ways. When the checks arrived, they were wrong. One drink was missing (finally, an error in our favor!) An order of fries was on the wrong check, as if one of us had asked for two orders. One of us was almost charged for the complimentary mousse! And last but not least, the cards were mixed up between a couple of books when they were returned.  I don't recall ever leaving a restaurant in such a bad mood, after eating something so good. The general mood was captured in my co-workers expression below... BT! Are you listening? Time to get your act in gear!

photos.caption: Photo of Burger Theory - Phoenix, AZ, United States

NqinB-jDrqiL44PxcW-OIA.text: So my husband treated me to burger theory for my birthday yesterday because it's close to our house and we hadn't tried it yet. I wasn't impressed. The French fries were awesome but my chicken sandwich was burned and it ruined my sandwich. My husband ordered a triple hamburger with several toppings and when our food came he received a hamburger with one Patty on it which surprised us because even our waitress had made a comment about the three hamburger patties being so huge on the hamburger. We told the waitress That his order wasn't correct so they redid his hamburger and it was fine after that. The waitresses were all very nice and it's a nice restaurant but I don't think it's worth the price for Mediocre food.

thNIyoQQQ4m7c5h7wDNZhw.text: This place is ok, but just okay. Nothing special. As a guest of the hotel, I would say BT's greatest attribute is it's convenience. It's situated nearly on one end of the property and delivers to your room. Very nice, clean, simple decor. Not too frilly, not a billion tvs and sports memorabilia everywhere. Plenty of seating without being crowded.   The food was hit or miss. The burgers were higher quality than a McDonald's, but not on par with an Applebee's or Chili's.   The chicken wings were actually really good. I got them naked (sauce on the side) and extra crispy. 5 stars for those. I also ordered fries. I didn't get them. I wasn't charged for them but I didn't get what I ordered.  My wife ordered fish tacos and about half way through them stated that they were incredibly tasteless. We then realized that the savory white sauce the menu boasted was missing.   At this particular meal it took incredibly long to get our food. Roughly 20 minutes after ordering and we were on of 4 tables at the time.  We ate here for 4 days and nothing stood out more than the chicken wings.  The bartender poured the cocktails nice and stiff. That was a plus.  We did the free breakfast buffet each day of our stay. It was good. Wide selection and attentive staff.  If we every return, we will eat here as a last resort.

gZ70DDRAMQaKVfNVomVLUQ.text: Love this place.  I have been to Phoenix on two occasions and stopped here both times.  Tasty burgers (no kidding).....good beer selection.....TV's showing all of the NFL games.....friendly locals...... good bartenders.  Yes sir!

AR5cnMHtWUn8Yjnn9zZxaQ.text: This restaurant is adjacent to the Holiday Inn & Suites North, on the ground level.  Came here on two different occasions.    The first time I came here was with my co-workers.  The waiter seemed to forget the silverware, because when we received our orders, none of us had silverware, which was quite odd, and a bit cold--we had to get our own silverware from surrounding tables, and ask for the missing ones.   In terms of the order, my co-worker and I both ordered the burgers with coleslaw, and the other ordering onion rings.  Tasted well, and no complaints there.  My other co-worker had a grilled chicken salad, and she seemed to enjoy her salad as well.  My second occasion was when I ordered my meal to go.  Ordered from the room first, and picked it up to go.  Ordered a fish filet sandwich, and it was quite good!  Although it definitely filled me up for the afternoon, I was glad I didn't get hungry throughout the day because I ended up having this one meal for the entire day, as I was super busy at work.  Second experience was much better than the first, and they were quick with my order.  Overall experience wasn't too bad, considering that this was literally one of the few places for a sit-down dining experience in the area.  Overall grade: A-

I ordered my burger with coleslaw, garlic mayo, lettuce, tomato, ketchup, and the other regulars, you know how a sandwich works. The burger was more than amazing. They were able to achieve a burger texture that was similar to eating beef. At other places you might encounter that rubbery or spongy stuff, not here. The coleslaw was great, the burger was perfect. If I still ate beef, I would still get their veggie burger over any real beef burger from any restaurant you pick; don't care if you're talking 5guys, or smashburger, or anywhere. This place's veggie burger beats them.The fries were perfectly crisp and seasoned.

jzhbO6Xa_25UgKc5NgzH2A.text: (Reminder - 3 stars means "A-OK" - not bad!)  Fries and onion rings are great. Burger was good - the one with the shortrib was nice and juicy. Meat was a littler firmer than I prefer (possibly over mixed and packed/formed too tight). Pleased to find out they make quite a few things in-house (signature sauces, etc.) and even have a special sporting even (NFL) LTO menu. Even many of the ingredients are higher quality than expected (fresh Wildflower bakery rolls, etc).   Noting, I did have different expectations once I found out they were connected to a hotel, but have no complaints other than there were not many servers on staff. TIP - when you notice that as you walk into a restaurant (especially at an off-time, always sit at the bar! we've learned this over time).  All-in-all a good gig especially if you're a hotel guest - very convenient. Do we need to go back? No. With our mecca of food in the PHX area we're still in search of the best burger out there and fellow yelp reviewers are lacking in giving places like Shake Shack, PV Burger Company and Hopp Doddy 5 stars - what!? JUST NO!

OUYzJ_ObLDUJcRaPFpd0Mg.text: Really good food service was great. My only complaint is that there was seasoning on the fries and that was not stated any where on the menu.

twQ5Sn7NCHUSvmnUgGEvQQ.text: This would be a five-star review, if it weren't for the store-bought hamburger buns.  You know, a simple Brioche roll would elevate these burgers into total awesomeness.  Anyway, they describe it as a "potato roll".  I stopped in for a company luncheon and there were about ten people in my group.  We were immediately seated and beverages provided.  Our server - I think her name was Anise, was simply awesome.  Her service was attentive without being obtrusive, and she handled every detail and special request with a smile.  I forget the name of the burger I had, but it was the only one that was a half-pound patty.  I requested medrare and substitute Onion Rings for the Fries.  Anise asked me if I wanted a sauce with the rings (Hello CB&C- get a fucking clue!), and offered a variety.  I chose the usual, ranch.  They also have a nice selection of typical appetizers, salads, entrees and some specialty burgers, or build your own burger.  Beverages remained full while we waited for our lunch.  When my burger arrived, it was a perfect med-rare, lightly seasoned and delicious.  The rings were big and bready, perfectly crisped, although the onion itself was a bit tough.  No matter, the breading was fine without it.  The dining room is clean, and typical hotel-style, but well furnished, and the bathrooms were nearby and clean as well.  There is a very nice elevated outdoor patio facing the intersection, which I imagine could get noisy, but it was too hot to sit out there anyway, even with shade.  I will definitely be back.

zLvRGgEPXrSEd-rYHpi2Rw.text: Staying at hotel connected, had breakfast and dinner today.  Service was friendly and timely l.  Dinner: wings and salad, wings tossed with BBQ and Buffalo sauce was perfect combination.  Salad was good with a spicy honey mustard.  Breakfast, eggs to order with the buffet, host was generous to allow.   Won't hesitate to come back.

PNP4L4xYuogLekxb4aIWRg.text: I have no idea how this place has such great ratings. We went on a Thursday evening when it wasn't that busy. It took 15 minutes to get our drink orders and I couldn't even guess how long it took to actually get our food.  The food was meh at best. Definitely nothing to write home about. The service was absolutely horrible.   The only highlight was the friendliness of the guy who greeted us at the door and said "thank you" as we left.

fkKhkTPE5nkItJGE8tdjxw.text: So I'm the yelper of the family and I've been assigned this task. My hubs is not a complainer. He won't send food back and will tolerate most anything. He'd rather sit an hour with an empty cup than to simply ask for a refill. Today he calls me after he and his coworkers go to lunch. Wow he's upset. He got a burger cross between a cheesesteak and something else. The cheese was rubbery, meat flavorless. He said he's never been to a place where he felt the food was INEDIBLE until today. Thank heavens his company paid or I'd have been one hot mamma! He did say the service was 'okay but not good' service, so there is that one star that's not truly deserved.

eRQd93QU3x29Uxu5Ca6Tbg.text: Uncomfortably quiet, sterile, depressing. Mediocre, overpriced burger. Took 20 min to get our drinks. There were only 5 other tables at the time. Definitely would not go back.

KbdEvHB7mKGitfDPWx8Zag.text: Don't bother. Wait staff was friendly but food was not good. Had the Theory Burger which had way too much injected sauce, instead of some fresh cheese as expected. I was hungry and squeezed it out to make it less decadent. My friend had a flatbread for lower calorie purposes, which was listed at 600 calories on the menu but based on it having about 1/2 inches of cheese and heavily laden in oil was likely more than 2,000 calories.

QNjU0hCpJeZj0-3UNl81-w.text: We had a lovely experience here, everything was clean and bright, all the staff was friendly and professional our food was brought out to us on time , we even ordered dessert it was fabulous  Highly recommended definitely will return.

lFoAQXksRWPKJzZuk78JGg.text: This was the first time and WOW! DELICIOUS. My husband and I did the build your own burger, we had turkey burgers with all the fixins. He had fries, I had salad. Lemonades were big tall glasses and refreshing. We also ordered some wings as an appetizer - yum! At the end we had the carrot cake in the jar, their signature little dessert, gosh sooooo good. Please eat here you won't be disappointed. This was around $60 for both me and my husband for this meal.

photos.caption: Photo of Burger Theory - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Jar style carrot cake. Amazing!
Photo of Burger Theory - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Another turkey burger, husband had mushrooms, double cheese and double meat with bacon and sauteed onions, with fries.
Photo of Burger Theory - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Huge side salad and thick turkey burger with house dressing.

aIT6ijCeQmZ9m2TNBu-1eA.text: Burgers were very tasty! Onion rings were delicious! Great craft beer selection on draft. Lots of TVs to catch your favorite team! Large glass garage doors open up to the outdoor patio.   We came late on a Sunday, and atmosphere was lacking any kind of energy. Definitely had the standard hotel bar vibe and was too quiet for a sports bar. This place has potential to be a fun joint with the right crowd. I would definitely return next time we are in Phoenix.

CsHJpj-xlPCs9yWXVHLW9w.text: Average  Burger Theory is a restaurant/bar  connected to the Holiday Inn in Phoenix.  The atmosphere is a trendy sports bar that is modern and clean.    On this visit my lunch companion and  I ordered a  burger and a side of fries.  I have to admit, the burgers were good, but nothing really stood out.  The burger was well cooked and juicy and the french fries were hot and crispy.  However, considering sides are extra, I think $10 for that burger is a little much.  I don't mind paying extra for a gourmet burger, but this burger really wasnt gourmet.  Total for two burgers, one order of french fries, and two sodas was $29.  The staff did their job; they were accommodating without being intrusive.  I recommend you give Burger Theory a try and decide for yourself if its worth the extra cost.
