U_rw3WR_k23TJJWAbKMOoA.text: The burger was indeed a good burger. I ordered the Lone Star which was a beef burger with cheddar cheese, an onion ring, bacon and bbq sauce. I give three stars because the service is a little slow considering there weren't a lot of people. Also I ordered my burger medium and it was medium well if not well. My husband ordered a double build your own and his was also cooked more than medium but overall still good. We ordered their chips as an appetizer. They were okay....honestly no different than a bag of plain lays. Overall, it was good but certainly not the best burger I've ever had.  Also, the idea of a tv at very booth is great thinking. My husband was able to request whichever FB game he wanted to see.

BQE1N6ACEPrbAaY4WOl0mg.text: I got two salads here after arriving at the holiday inn late after traveling all day. I called from my room and they told me that it would take 20 minutes. Well I walked over to the hotel room after 17 minutes had passed and my food was not ready for another 15. In fact, I'm not even sure my order was taken. Even though it was dinner time, there wasn't anyone inside so I do not know why the service was so poor. The food, however, was great.

GqjoLiCgskQpsseDRgeFuA.text: Food: I've gotten the Breakfast Burger (with mushrooms) and the Lone Star (with mushrooms and fried egg), and they were both delicious. The bun is a little heavy in my opinion, so the most recent time I went, I got the burger wrapped in lettuce, which I loved. The fresh crunch really complemented the BBQ sauce on the Lone Star. The one gripe I have is that because their fried egg was extra runny, the yolk caused the paper that the burger is served on to tear, and so since I was cutting my lettuce-wrapped burger, I ended up eating some paper... yuck! The shoestring-y fries were super hot and crispy and delicious though!   Vibe: The first time I went, I got weird vibes, because it's directly attached to a Holiday Inn, but I've gotten used to it now. Inside, it has an upscale-meets-sports bar feel. The service is nice, but not the most efficient. Last time I went, there was live music. The guy had a great voice, and he was just playing acoustic guitar and singing, but he was a little loud (and I was at the booth furthest from him!)  Parking is super easy, since it's part of the hotel. I've been working to take more pictures of food when I go out to eat,but I always forget when I come here...too excited to eat, I guess. Next time, maybe.

c4cUKmAiV_6PN0DVppOdaw.text: Had the Lone-star burger, it was cooked perfectly.  The crunchy onion rings, crispy/chewy bacon, cheese and BBQ sauce all served as valued contributors to the pink burger.  Juicy, sweet, crunchy, salty, chewy, rich... I will be back.

v3QspwTgSjQWcJWGWrAtJA.text: So-so experience. The wait staff was very attentive, but the food was mediocre.  The chicken is very dry, no matter how you order it. (I had it for lunch and dinner different ways) I ordered the grilled chicken burger with avocado wrapped in lettuce in stead of a bun. I could barely find the avocado, and the there were maybe eight mushrooms total. For dinner I had the Asian chicken salad. There was about a half a chicken breast on a huge pile of lettuce. Again the chicken was dry and chewy.   My grandsons burger was ok, but nothing special for a place with BURGER in the title. Beware... they say the kids meal is free with a full price order if you are a guest at the hotel, but they won't ask you if you are a guest even if you enter from the hotel side... they will just charge you for it. I had to ask that it was removed from my dinner bill even after I told her I would be putting the bill on my room.  I pointed out that I was charged for the kids meal at lunch but they said I would need to go through some sort of drama to have it retroactively removed because that wait staff was gone. Seems like it should have been a simple fix.  Maybe the burgers they make for the kids are mediocre because they are free... perhaps the specialty burgers are better...not sure I will try again to find out. First impressions are everything   Very convenient being connected to the hotel.

7K-p_ERETYMl9fcEIIbMoQ.text: We love Burger Theory!  They always have great beer on tap, their burgers are DELICIOUS and affordable and the service is always solid. Plus they're always super accommodating to our little one. Great low-key spot to grab some good beers and delicious burgers.   Thanks, Burger Theory!

Y3_IR42OFu7UjYURAlubHw.text: Who would have thought this place was part of a Holiday Inn! Wow what a great burger. Really love what these guys are doing, tasty, and delicious burger, check out our full video burger review here: youtu.be/Aszaj-dNthg

mR0yIRiA93ZN8Q7nOcLgJA.text: Burger Theory has a lot of things I like about it, (Sunday NFL games and Bloody Mary bar) and some weird things I don't, (mostly average burgers and high prices). It's a three star rating in my book having eaten here many times since April of 2017 when we moved just down the street and am forced to go here. Service can be great, or you can wait forever and not be helped. Some food items are outstanding, like the salads and onion rings, some are just a theory still being studied...like the burgers. What's up with putting lettuce under the burger patty? Burger juice and mushroom juice all dripping into the lettuce for that delicious very wilted, warm lettuce we all crave, (sarcasm alert). Crispy lettuce on the side please! Or just bring me some of your awesome wings instead!  Besides the well designed logo and menu plus great wings and fire cracker shrimp, there is a lot to like at this place attached to the Hotel with TVs everywhere that only show news or the golfing channel it seems, (except NFL Sunday my favorite day to stop by). Sunday games, good appetizer menu, and a manager that seems to have improved this place in recent months, has raised my review from 3 stars to 4.   I will end by saying I took my brother and nephew here one day for lunch and the onion rings, fries, fish sandwich, cole slaw and chicken strips were all great! Service excellent. My brother enjoyed his burger with an egg on it as well, (not my idea of a good burger but whatever). We had a great time! Now I want that fish sandwich and onion rings tonight!

p27yn-g8NHkPShT8OZggJQ.text: Yummy! My husband and I tried this since it's just down the street and it's great! Really cool on the inside, enough TVs if you want to watch a game, attentive staff, and delicious food. We got an app and we each built a burger. It definitely lived up to our expectations and we will be back!

mD7vZOX-6oREm1RIgIk8Dg.text: Well, my original intention was to write this review from the public bathroom less than 2 miles from Burger Theory, but as I sat there trying, I realized that I was too busy concentrating on keeping my insides inside of me. The intestinal exorcism was like nothing I have experienced before.   Decor - 4 stars. BT looks good inside and would fit in about 4 miles northwest of its current location easily.   Service - 3 stars. Aaron did an average job. He was a little confused on the "Staff Pick" beer which seemed a little strange since the staff picked it.   Pricing - 2 stars. Happy Hour draft is a good deal and is par for the area. 3 stars for that. They lose a star with their burger pricing which I will go into details on next   Food Quality - 1 star due to the fact that negative stars aren't an option.  We ordered the Firecracker Shrimp appetizer and the flavor wasn't horrible, but was served at a strange temperature.  Burgers(should be great as it's in the name) were tricky. The flavor wasn't the worst we've had, but the color of the patties was off-putting to say the least. We ordered both burgers medium, which Aaron said would be slightly pink(as it should) but they were served grayish with no pink. I've had plenty of burgers in my life and I am pretty sure this is the first gray one I've seen.  Fries were soft and warm - far from hot. Maybe were sitting around for a while. The flavor wasn't horrible though and were seasoned decently.  Onion rings were probably the highlight of the dinner. Not sure if they were fried out of a bag or not, but were above average in taste.   At the conclusion of our $71 dinner with tip, we made our way north. By the time we made it 1 mile to Thomas, I was desperately looking for a public restroom as I didn't want to ruin the seats of my truck and my clothes. BT has dethroned the champion of Intestinal Distress, Panda Express now and will be my go-to place any time I feel constipated.   On a side note, I will be back for Happy Hour beers... I mean, who can say "No" to a $3 local craft beer?

nW-yebbWha6uudWMXFhu6Q.text: I think I'm giving a lot here with 3 stars.  The service is that of fast food (very poor) however the manager did throw in a desert for free  due to the fact that my drink order never came.  The hostesses had to bring me my drink!  The food is definitely better than other burger places such as Red Robin.  Btw as I write this the table next to me is complaining that they've been waiting a long time for the check.

jqyKnCCUmta1TH4aD1Ukkg.text: My experience was horrible. At first glance it looks great but thats where the it ends. The burger is the size of a Wendy's Jr cheese burger for $15!!!!!! I ordered a well done burger which ended up being medium at best. The French fries were chewy and barely warm. The waitress didn't bring the olives that I order in my margarita. I then had to remind her that I order olives. She did not bring any of sauces I ordered. The service was poor but the worst part of it all was that my food was such a disappointment. I will never come here again!!!!

i66OO4WH80jouwMTwAsHEw.text: Karri took care of us and did a great job. The breakfast burger was perfect. Also try the KBG sauce.

cesI1zbnRMx-879JS9z92g.text: Super good burgers. Fries and onion rings were awesome!! Waitress Karrie was super friendly. Overall great experience and will for sure return.

D-p7pUl3EdN4MBRtov9TQg.text: Great food and environment. Karrie was a super server - give it a try and ask for her if you can

Igupy8KEmigsjS84T_pIBw.text: The menu looked amazing and my husband and I were super excited to try this new place.  After ordering waters to drink, and practically memorizing the menu while waiting for our server to come back, we walked out after attempting to get the attention of the two bartenders, the manager and two servers (maybe hosts?)  hovering at the bar. Two stars for decor and concept, unfortunately I have no desire to go back and try the amazing looking menu.

_DNQ8hXAH9GvdGAS0bEtMA.text: Solid service from Larry Legend, will be back. Burger was huge, Sonoran white chocolate and orange blossom  on tap!

p0UztbWtUdQrwEVRGy9jTQ.text: Great burgers with a great atmosphere. The decor is modern-industrial with a casual feel. My group each had different burgers and all were cooked perfectly and tasted so good. Definitely get the KGB sauce for your burger.

vn3OaYlHn4yxM0l9DcBqvg.text: Don't get Nachos. Cheese sauce was awful. Margarita was a small rock glass. Stick to beer and burgers.

hxuXEtUMn9edWQ5xvQW7tQ.text: Wow waited over 45 minutes for a hamburger, bad service, no one even cracked a smile, expensive, hamburgers decent tasting , definitely would not go back.

5yhdp1jR9c39gK-KIUaUQA.text: Ordered lunch for a group of 16. Everything was perfect and delicious! The order was ready on time and the customer service was exceptional! Bigger tip next time! Deserved!

dLd-i8NMgT55tEpUQnVhrQ.text: Worst experience me and my friends have ever had waited over 20 minutes for a drink and over 45 minutes for our food we only are allowed to have an hour lunch at work and we spoke to the manager she said only five more minutes they brought our bill but not our food 10 minutes later we were very frustrated by this we will never eat there again and we do not recommend this to our friends please stay away

OMdLlLVPDscCOssKTENt3w.text: Probably my least favorite choice for a burger in the Phoenix area. The patio was dirty, even by a hipster's standard, and looked like it hadn't been cleaned in weeks. Prices were incredibly high for what you got and fries were sold separately, served cold  at that and under seasoned. Craft beer options are mostly unavailable. I won't be back.

GZ66z7cPg6M57nk6r4AQzA.text: Worst service ever!!!!! I can't even comment on the food because after waiting for more than an hour we never got our food, although the lousy waitress was nice enough to bring by the check for everything that was never even delivered to our table.  Here's the experience -  First we were excited about trying the place as it seemed good based on the ads and all that. Me, wife, and two kids (1 and 7) arrive, get seated outside and order drinks - a couple kids drinks, and two beers.   20 minutes later, no drinks and we never saw our waitress. Complained to the manager who said she would get our waitress but she still did not return.  Another waiter who seemed to be on the ball walked by and we asked to place order with him. To his credit he did not make excuses and he just took our order and said he was sorry and would handle it.  Later the beers finally arrive from our original waitress - 2 bottles of beer - (no idea why it took 25 minutes to open two bottles of beer). The original waitress then apologized and said they were busy and she got tied up. We accepted the apology and thought maybe she will make it better.  Then we got no service and no food for another 20 minutes. Now it's been 45 minutes and again we complain to the manager and the original waitress. Both say they will take care of it and the manager says she will comp the meal. Also they do bring out the kids meals at this point (Mac and cheese and kids pizza).  Now another 25 minutes go by with no food and no service. I walk inside and tell the original waitress to make it to go if it's even close to being ready. She says she will.  Then the food still doesn't come but she brings the check to the table for us to pay. My wife says we aren't paying for this and already talked to the manager.  The manager then finally brings the food and try's to deliver it to the wrong table!!!!   It never ends. She then brings the food to our table and it's not made to go!!!  We were done. Waited more than an hour, never took a bite of the food so I can't make any comments on of its good or not, but the service absolutely sucks.   We tried to talk to manager again and she was nowhere to be found.  We spoke to a another manager named Carlos who was very apologetic. I told him I refused to pay for any of this due to what happened and he agreed we should not pay. He also offered to buy us a meal another time and gave us the number to call the general manager.  I'll give him credit as he was very professional, but if you only get that service when you get to the top guy at the place and everyone else does a bad job, it may be too little, too late.

ygAiV-e1vuWqxNIHI0yxcg.text: I love this place! Happy Hour is awesome! Camilo was my bartender and he made sure we had a great first experience. It's a bit far from me but it is definitely worth the drive! Make sure to sit at the bar to have a great view of all the beer selections!

bUj9s6SsE5ZKYbSp5AEOBg.text: Damn, that was a really good burger. Not much else to say, good atmosphere, cheap prices, solid service. I'll come back for sure.

IOUVuzEWgqrl9n61_qeBLA.text: It's cool, not ground breaking. A small bar looks inviting, and the food is above average. I like the service, but with the creative burgers that exist in Arizona.....I think they need to reinvent and make their burgers exciting. Not saying not to eat here, its a good burger, but nothing to go crazy over.

3wi5Q4wxm_pY7sir33LVLg.text: Loooooove this place! It is a little on the pricier side, but the food was great and the service was even better. The misters are also a nice touch on the patio.

2i-qQXijloNMpEpD4l82SA.text: I really like this place! The menu is fun.  Many different options for premade burgers, salads and soups.  But the fun part is make your own burger! You get to chose your protein (veggie patty and portabello's avail for the non meat eater), pick your veggies, cheese, condiments and extras like a fried egg! So they have vegan and veggie options! The service was also great.  We stopped on our way to a concert so told our server we were in a hurry and he did not disappoint! Got our food, ate well, paid our check and gone!   Side note: there is an affiliation with Holiday Inn which I think is a brilliant concept for travelers.  Don't have to eat at the cheezy diner next door or the basic hotel kitchens when traveling.   Next time out around Arcadia area look this place up and give it a try!

photos.caption: Photo of Burger Theory - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Build your own burger: double beef patty, cheddar cheese, bacon,  lettuce,  tomato and a side of coleslaw!
Photo of Burger Theory - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Build your own: veggie patty, sauted onions, mushrooms, lettuce and tomato! Yum!! Side of their seasoned fries!

mKfo1VBprxqGmEdKJYxnMA.text: A fair option for lunch burger spot.  Although not my first choice the variety and build to your own style make it a middle ground if you're in a party with picky eaters.  They have regular beef patties (single or double order), chicken, and veggie/portabello mushroom options. Everything that comes out is cooked to your expectation and absolutely edible. Don't forget to pair with a beer, the burgers are on the smaller side.  I ordered the farm fresh burger, the cheese was the highlight that added the saltiness and delivered most of the flavor.  The onion rings were huge, fries were crispy, and salad was a standard house salad with a side of ranch.  A bit on the pricier side and with so many other options available in the area.

photos.caption: Photo of Burger Theory - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Farm fresh burger

icrdfhHclwxbvpIJYq6L_Q.text: 2 strikes this place is OUT! Boyfriend likes the Lone Star Burger as it has a substantial onion ring and good bbq sauce.  The Service has improved since my visit 15 months ago and Courtney did a great job at 10pm on a Friday, there were maybe 4 tables total.    However my all American burger was not good, the bun dry and tasteless it soaked up their sauce.  Patty was juicy and tasted good once I removed that awful bun.  Fries subtle seasoned but limp!  While this place opens early it is not for Burgers  bj ut breakfast at the hotel.... buffet.

photos.caption: Photo of Burger Theory - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Line Star Burger and Fries
Photo of Burger Theory - Phoenix, AZ, United States. All American Burger and Fries

kMWhxaNTZuPbhN4NV0R5Gg.text: I adored this burger. it had some berry jalapeno relish on it that I want to bottle and take with me everywhere. It is a burger place. That is what I am reviewing, the burgers. The fries were super, too. The service was not stellar but I am reviewing a burger place. My expectations are not what they would be if this was fine dining. I will go back. Definitely.

photos.caption: Photo of Burger Theory - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Super
Photo of Burger Theory - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Theory burger
Photo of Burger Theory - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Classic

0_IaWbzC56WEJ6ROOYv8QQ.text: DAYUM DAYUM DAYUM This place was so freaking good. They breaded their own chicken and it's not frozen. If you like burgers gotta try the Theory Burger amazing. If you you're vegan I promise the grill vegetable has some lovin in it. Camillo the bartender made good drinks and very professional; everything served with a smile.

photos.caption: Photo of Burger Theory - Phoenix, AZ, United States. This place is sooooo good!

RJ_m6QsNwXnhO4GtFWZvOA.text: Wow !!!  This place is a must for Phoenix.    I had the Lonestar Burger.   Ordered medium rare, yes it's real meat!  Topped with cheese, bacon, onion ring, smothered in BBQ sauce, with a 1/4 pickle on the side.  It was juicy, tasty, and perfect!    I also tried the Buttermilk tenders.   It coated perfectly with batter, and the chicken was juicy.  And yes it's real chicken.     The bar is nice and roomy,  the patio is heated for the winter, and cooled for the hot summer days.

photos.caption: Photo of Burger Theory - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Burger Theory - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Lonestar burger
Photo of Burger Theory - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Buttermilk Tenders

T9QDJqvE0V6IiltrjyND8A.text: Four stars for the food. I was actually quite surprised at how good it actually was. I took the many yelp suggestions and tried the fire shrimp. Crispy fried perfection and the sweet sauce (nothing but Mae Ploy But who cares!)  The double turkey burger was excellent. The slaw was on point but those fries tho! Man I'm glad I sampled them.   Once I was waited on the place was fine... I stood out front trying to obey the directive "please wait to be seated" for 5 minutes. Without an acknowledgement, I simply sat out on the patio where MNF was on... since no one was coming to my table nor the others who had patrons dotted around the massive space, I couldn't ask em to put the DUBs on the big screen. As I'm hating on NFL these days. Finally after another 5-10 just as I was about to abandon ship. A waitress i have not seen milling around in the main dining area shows up. I was so darn excited I went ahead and ordered in case she would disappear again.  Food came promptly and was darn good!

D3hk9VKL7wiDSbUa7aG8mw.text: Ate here 2 nights in a row because I was staying at the hotel. Both nights the food was so bad (I mean bad) I can't believe people eat here. First night very sloppy burger (frozen then grilled) and it had no flavor minus the sauce which was pouring off. Next night flatbread where the bottom was black as a sharpie marker with the top still cold. The horrible moldy taste needed comet to remove.

4Kmll6ZVl3LJCgbcyWh06w.text: Flew into Phoenix for the night before heading home.  Got in late, so we wanted to find something close to our hotel.  Burgers sounded divine, so we decided this would be the spot to check out.  It's a nice spot.  Your normal run of the mill burger place.  We sat at the bar and had wine.  Not crazy expensive, so that was a plus.  For food, I decided on the Southwestern Burger.  The burger was good, but lacking.  It needed a kick... whether that be spicy jalapenos or some sort of hot sauce.  Burger patty was pretty tasty.  The fries were the star.  We ended up eating fries with a side of nacho cheese sauce later because the burger didn't fill me up, and we wanted another bite that wouldn't break the bank.  The bartender suggested that, and I was glad he did.  Service was pretty good.  The bartender was friendly.  A little lacking in service, but still pretty good for the hour of the night we were there.  Overall, a good burger place.  Nothing that will knock your socks off, but it's good.

photos.caption: Photo of Burger Theory - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Southwestern Burger. Good, but it needs a kick. A little boring. The fries are super fresh.

fwMn53PfrZDTAThopOabOw.text: Me and my BFF went there for lunch, a couple of week ago. I order a Asian Chicken salad, ummm it looked so good, started to eat on it, low and behold there was a lady bugs crawling around in my salad, I was so disgusted, after trying to get the waiter attention I thought I just take it up to them, upon returning back to the table my BFF discovered bugs on her Turkey burger ;( I took the burger back showed them the bugs, our waiter apologized. we waited a little while to see if a manager would come to us to apologized or anything needless to say, No manager showed up so we left there very disappointed and we will never be back.  Warning...The food may look good, but you might want to examine it before you go at it!

fruiAsPKOUEelvcs6f1vpA.text: 1st time customer in town for work.  I'm definitively got the burger my way and next time I'm in town I'll be back. Get burgers and great service!

PcUFpOwD3G2znlJmBwK7Tg.text: Dreadful. Terrible service. Terrible food. One of the worst dining experiences I've had in a long, long time.   Arrived to a "Please Wait to Be Seated" sign at about 1:30pm on a Monday. My colleague and I didn't see anyone else in the restaurant. At about the 5 minute mark, with two other people standing behind us, I started to wander towards the back when the bartender suddenly appeared and indicated we could sit anywhere.   Another 8 minutes went by before we were greeted at the table by a waitress.   We placed our entire order, I ordered my burger medium rare and verified she has it correct.   The food came in about 10 minutes, not bad. That was the last time we saw our waitress before we had to flag her down, in an empty restaurant, to give us a check.   My burger was cooked well. It was terrible. But we didn't see any staff while we ate. No one. Everyone was in the back. So I smothered my incredibly dry hamburger in ketchup, choked it down (without any beverage refills) and after paying, left happy to never return to this dreadful restaurant.   The waitress never checked on us after the food came. Not once. Not even when she brought the check did she inquire if we enjoyed the meal.

gra45q6YqGq0-p5G0uTNHA.text: 1st and last time here. Nice place sat outside watched traffic, took forever to get my burger and 4 fries. Not rememberable, our waiter sucked. I didn't finish my burger and didn't bring it home.

USZ1KslCv5DJPLmH56KeHw.text: So if you don't mind a pricey burger, this place has excellent food. My boyfriend and I have been on a bit of a burger kick and tried a few places. I was disappointed the last few times, but finally decided to splurge and try Burger  Theory.  Now, we like to joke about the name, but these burgers are not theoretical, they do exist! They were delicious, tasty beef and bacon, yummy seasoned fries, and good lemonade.  One thing though, you basically have to drive around the hotel to get there. The median islands make it hard to turn in depending on which way you're coming from. Service was also good, but they were not busy at all. We will probably go back when we're really in the mood for burgers and don't mind paying extra.

b2j961SXZZkh5lMODLzHww.text: I visited restaurant on a Wednesday atmosphere was really relaxed. Restaurant has a really nice bar and updated interior. Wide selection of food in menu and all very tasty. Customer service was friendly and enjoyable.

Y2UON4gy_5s16h9UGXSCWA.text: The food is not the best. A little on the bland side. Huge portions...The happy hour drinks are priced very well though. Our waitress Anisa was super sweet and attentive! We'd come back solely for her customer service savvy!

eTEb-vMpdQ20Gvwxws4UsA.text: The overall ambience is impressive but does feel a bit cold since there is so much space that is not utilized.  Service was good and portions are large. The burgers are just ok. I ordered the classic which might be why it was so plain. They use a thousand island dressing on the burger with Garlic that they call KGB sauce which sounded interesting... it's just thousand island dressing.  The price tag for a burger ranges $12-$18 which for the portion size is a bit more than most other places. Didn't find the burger worth it in the end.

photos.caption: Photo of Burger Theory - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Classic burger

BO0p_WxlVvTtb_XrCOf8ow.text: Burger Theory is a semi-upscale burger joint that's directly attached to the Holiday Inn hotel located off McDowell and 44th Street. We've passed by it several times and have always been curious, but reluctant to try it due to the mediocre reviews. Further research revealed that Holiday Inn actually owns it, operating as a chain connected to some of their hotels in other cities.   Well, it turns out those reviews are pretty accurate.  We stopped by during prime dining time on a Tuesday night and it wasn't very busy. I opted for the breakfast burger, which consists of an egg, bacon, cheddar, garlic mayo, and something called KGB sauce. Apparently, this is an acronym for "Killer Good Burger" sauce? My girlfriend ordered the "classic," which consists of American cheese, onions, lettuce, tomato, the same sauce, and holding the pickles.  Everything was just standard-fare. My burger was okay, although if you're familiar with the area, you'll know that superior burgers can be found for identical prices. My girlfriend was annoyed that her bun started falling apart almost immediately, which is never a good sign.  French fries were fine, but again, simply fine is usually not enough to impress me these days. In short, don't go in here expecting anything special, because you won't find it.  Overall, I suppose if you're staying at the hotel, it's a respectable option for room service. But if you're out actually exploring the neighborhood for a good burger, this definitely wouldn't be my first choice.  Recommended for hotel guests only.

VAePVcmN1yw4swu35TMKBg.text: One more food review coming right up! Out of convenience, I stopped by Burger Theory with a friend. One thing I did appreciate was the fact that they are open late(midnight on a week night). The place is well lit and there is a large bar in the center with booths and tables spread around the place. Parking was convenient as it is part of the hotel next door.  Now for the food. Subpar at best. My friend got a burger and fries and I went for the chicken flatbread. Now for a small Flatbread that wasn't that appetizing,it was surprisingly  $9. My friend stated that his burger was okay but there was really nothing to rave about. All in all, Burger Theory will not be making my top 15 in places for Burger and brew.

kEb8VcZ8jL1W-H-N1CF4Gg.text: This place just opened up down the street from me. I've had decent experienced at other locations, so I thought I'd give it a shot. While the servers attentiveness and response times were excellent, the food was a completely different story. I feel that if I'm spending $40 for a burger, coke, and appetizer it should be a step or two above a run of the mill fast-food joint. The meat was so greasy and tasteless. Both top and bottom buns was heavily saturated in grease that you couldn't enjoy any of the "craft" condiments and toppings. I know a melt in your mouth burger when I taste it, but never a melt on the plate because of the excessive great. There was a lot to be desired with this one. Felt like it was a frozen, season-less slop of grease. On a positive note,the onion rings were pretty great.

pS3KNsII8WNvrlYZHtPYlw.text: One of my favorite restaurants to go to when I want something quick and delicious. They have one of the best turkey burgers I've ever had. That's what turned me on, and kept me coming to Burger theory. The chicken tenders are the best, crunchiest, Hottest you'll ever have. The waitresses are always super nice and smiling. The drinks are strong and I wouldn't have it any other way. One thing I'll say is that sometimes the service can be a tiny bit slow at the bar. But I'll take sometimes slow when the food, and the people are so great.

K7Sr2rg8pCUzjdysO0DoFg.text: I highly recommend this place! I tried it for Restaurant Week and was not disappointed.  They had a great selection of local beer. Their wings were a 4.5 out of 5 on my scale, and I'm very picky about wings.  The sauce was a perfect mix of heat with a little sweet.  The Lone Star burger was perfectly cooked and delicious.  And I loved their mason jar brownie sundae.  My only wish was for a more engaged waiter.  He came to the table, but never really asked if we needed anything or how our food was. Otherwise I will definitely be back to try the other burgers.

dNrT0lGfxT2xRIj7odtZqQ.text: So I am here now with my significant other. We came in to the restaurant around 6:30AM, and the waitress, (I believe her name was Karrie) completely ignored us. We tried three times to ask her where we should sit, and each time she proceeded to very blatantly ignore us! Finally, the waiter (Michael) must have noticed what was happening and kindly helped us find a seat immediately. Now at first, I just thought Karrie was just rude, and poorly qualified for the job, but after sitting for a few minutes I began to notice something. Each time an older white male entered the restaurant, Karrie greeted them with a warm (and very loud) welcome! She would say things like, "Good morning! Have a seat where ever you'd like!" Or "Good morning! How are you?!". After observing a bit longer, I noticed she only provided service (I.E. topping off drinks and bring tabs etc) to the same "genre" of customers (white males), and all of the minority customers were all serviced by Michael. Now, I don't know if it was the waitress' personal issue against people of color, OR if that is what management has instructed her to do, but either way, I will not support a business that allows blatant discrimination in any way shape or form.   On a side note, if I were basing my review solely on the service we received from Michael, then 5 stars hands down! If my review were solely based on the service that we observed from Karrie, I would give this place negative stars if I could.   If you are a person of color, please be aware of the blatant discrimination by the waitress or possibly management, and be sure to leave Micheal a good tip because he's excellent!

gsvFbn2hx8nbS6VLL9luFA.text: After a long day of apartment hunting in the valley I was drained and hungry. Being from Chicago the valley has to step up in regards to the culinary options.  Today I had a hankering for a burger.  Not a fast food burger. A fresh made burger with personality.  After driving past this place several times the name intrigued me. Today I explored.   Upon entering i was met with super friendly staff and a clean atmosphere. Seated at a low top the multiple televisions give a great potential for a Sunday morning football spot.     Ben was my server.  This guy knew his burgers. There were several burgers in the menu and the daily special which was a meat lovers.  In short imagine taking a deli and slamming it on top gourmet fresh made burger.  The juices alone are worth a try due to the freshness of all the meats. This was a mans burger. Piled high on top of a toasted gourmet bun.  The happy hour here for drinks is great too. Cheap local domestics and imports.   To top it off Bens knowledge of the menu and the suggestion of the Smores jar put this place over the top.     Amazing customer service   Thanks Ben

P-S1xVqDgDbxt2JxETSzcw.text: Had the breakfast burger and was super disappointed when the egg was overdone .  I also payed extra money to try the sweet potato fries and they brought out regular fries. It was mid week at 7 p.m. and wasn't very busy and our food took 25 minutes to come out, so I wasn't about to wait longer to get the right fries.  Needless to say I was less than impressed with burger theory .

ltf01hZ-qZwevTPc6aSkcA.text: *Great Food* Just self sat myself; the bartender left his post to help us and are server was nowhere to be found! Seems like management here sucks! The bartender seems like he cares more than management!  Food came out on time although they forgot my +$1 jalapeno but they took that off.. The food was great but they need better management go to the bartender josh and he'll be a great help! But if you want a good meal you can come here!

fO8y9m9MjV2MSt638W4Yyg.text: Had the firecracker shrimp and a hamburger. Was perfectly cooked. Will definitely come back.
